about_the_game:
Carried by the winds, the agile explorers of Hraesvelg do not need to occupy a large territory, for they will readily venture outside to gather resources. Their profound knowledge of the terrain and their ability to exploit it to its fullest allows them to survive in the most desolate of areas. They are led by Grif, the sole survivor of a fallen clan.






Orphaned upon the fall of their parent’s clan, Grif was adopted at a young age by the followers of Hraesvelg. This demonstration of adaptability made them a perfect leader for the Eagle clan.




Falconers can be assigned to Aviaries to explore uncharted lands, releasing Hawks that will gather resources on Boneyards and assist your sentinels. Falconers can open and access Ruins or Shipwrecks and seal Wolf Dens or Draugr Tombs outside your territory.



Reveals a Forbidden Cache containing great riches and equally great dangers…



  • The Aviary replaces the Scout Camp. Their number is limited to 3 but they don't use a building slot. Falconers can't get hurt and collect Lore when they explore a new zone. They can explore Ruins or Shipwrecks and close Wolf Dens or Draugr Tombs outside their territory.

  • Cleared zones become Boneyards. For 2 months, units within the zone will be healed and Hawks will come to gather resources. The number of Hawks on a Boneyard depends on how many foes you killed in it and how many Aviaries you built.

  • Your Aviaries will reveal Buried Cache on the map over time.

  • You gain no Fame for the size of your territory.



Nomadic Tribe | Fame 200

Units outside their territory consume 30% less Food and Firewood. Zones can be upgraded using Food. In upgraded zones, houses give +1 population and military buildings give +1 warband.


Scavenging | Fame 500

Ruins, Shipwreck, and all special zones can be explored once more to gain additional resources (except the Fame). It is possible to reclaim a colonization bonus from a zone that already gave one.




Foraging

You gain 60% more resources when closing a Wolf Den, a Draugr Tomb or colonizing a zone.


Sentinel

Falconers gain Watch Keeping: The Falconer deploys his Hawk to keep watch of everything happening in the zone, improving attack power of military units by 10% and production of allied specialized units by 15%


Rapine

The Boneyard effect is applied to decolonized zones. All your Hawks get resources from enemy production buildings in the zone.


Training Field

You gain +1 Happiness for each unclaimed zone adjacent to your territory with no hostile units.


Blood Eagle

Falcons protect allied units in Boneyards by using Blind: A Hawk will blind this unit, all its attacks will miss for 3 seconds.
